entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - The Delve (iOS, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - The Delve (iOS, 2016)20161026
I played the first map of my first round of The Delve that I
played. It was fun, but a little bit easy. I used Syndrael,
Ashrian, Widow Tarha, and Tomble Burrowell. I got some good
bonuses from the Search tokens and defeated everything before
continuing. The set up and tear down time was a bit painful.

Total time: 1:16
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - The Delve
  • iOS
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (3)20161023
I played for about two hours on one of the side quests after
spending XP. I separated my heroes and got totally creamed. I
should have kept them together and not opened so many doors so
quickly. I definitely learned a lot but will start over the next
time I play. I also sorted all the tiles to make them easier to
find in the future.

Total time: 3:39
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins
  • iOS
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016) (2)20161023
I finished it. It was very interesting. Very little world-building,
which made it not as good as the normal books. In fact, that's why
the alternate reality was the most interesting part. Nevertheless,
it was very fun. I think it would make an excellent movie,
especially with all of the action.
  • Books
  • 2016

entry.title: Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016)
entry.content:
Book: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, by Jack Thorne (2016)20161022
I started reading this today and was very impressed with how
quickly I was wrapped up in the story. I really like the idea of
Albus being a nobody and having compassion for Scorpius. It's a
great premise.
  • Books
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins (iOS, 2015) (2)20161021
The kids picked characters and we went through the tutorial. I'm
surprised at how long it took. I dislike how long it takes to get
the board ready and clean it up. In particular, I'd like to be
able to leave everything out and come back to it, but I think that
doing so would be really unwise because of all the nefarious
things my kids could do. The tutorial seemed to trying to go easy,
but it was actually quite hard.

Total time: 1:44
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition - Road to Legend - Rise of Goblins
  • iOS
  • 2015

entry.title: Movie: Ghostbusters, starring Melissa McCarthy (2016)
entry.content:
Movie: Ghostbusters, starring Melissa McCarthy (2016)20161021
This was very funny. I enjoyed a lot of the gags and the references
to other things. I really enjoyed Kevin's role in the movie. I
thought there was a surprising amount of weird over-acting that
seemed to be done for laughs, but was out of place.
  • Movies
  • 2016

entry.title: Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000) (3)
entry.content:
Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000) (3)20161021
I finished the book today and thought about how it relates to the
popularity of various technical solutions. There is a sense in
which popular is the same as fame when there's no objective
standard (i.e. no profit-based evaluation.) I feel like among
programming languages that are all virtually equivalent, this is
the case. Languages that are very flashy, like dunkers in the NBA,
get a lot of attention, while languages with good fundamentals are
actually better for business.
  • Books
  • 2000

entry.title: Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000) (2)
entry.content:
Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000) (2)20161020
The discussion about why the NBA doesn't just have exhibition
matches of the top players (Jordan vs Shaq) was very
interesting. It was also really neat to read "the converge of
quality", which contained the factoid that Babe Ruth had more home
runs than any other TEAM in the entire league.
  • Books
  • 2000

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016) (3)20161019
I accomplished most of my sub-quests. I didn't do that garden,
though. I fought another battle after building the steel stockade
and it was really awesome to have the fortification kill all the
monsters for me. Rad!

Total time: 5:50

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016) (2)20161018
I played for a while and did a lot of little quests. I am trying
to get a few side-quests done, but I can't find the places to
go. I am trying to find the garden again to help the hammer guy
built one, as well as the graveyard in the desert. I need to get
back to the castle to get some more wheat. And finally, I need to
rearrange a lot of my base to make the steel stockade.

Total time: 4:45
  • Video Games
  • Dragon Quest Builders
  • PS4
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Dragon Quest Builders (PS4, 2016)20161017
I played this game for a while. It is really fun. I like the
Minecrafty-ness but with a purpose. The writing is very cute. I
like having the big TODO-list of things to build and get done. I'm
a few battles in and enjoying myself.

Total time: 3:07
  • Video Games
  • Dragon Quest Builders
  • PS4
  • 2016

entry.title: Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000)
entry.content:
Book: What Price Fame?, by Tyler Cowen (2000)20161017
I started this today. It is very insightful so far and makes me
want to disconnect myself even more than I already do from popular
culture.

  • 2000

entry.title: Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (31)
entry.content:
Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (31)20161016
I played a few more days. I'm almost to the end of Fall. I'm
feeling like there's really no point to playing any more. I do the
same thing every day and I have no more goals in the game. I think
I will stop. It's definitely a fun game, but you "beat it" long
before you actually "beat it". I was kind of hoping to hold out
until the rating by the Grandpa, but I just can't do it.

Total time: 65:37
  • Video Games
  • Stardew Valley
  • Steam
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (30)
entry.content:
Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (30)20161015
I played a few days. Just a grind of getting money and managing
the farm with no particular end in sight. It's amazing how many
little things I need to do every day!

Total time: 63:52
